abstract: As quarterly profits rise, the German giant said it planned a Japanese joint venture, an acquisition of units of Rolls-Royce, and a shift of its power units to the United States.
snippet: As quarterly profits rise, the German giant said it planned a Japanese joint venture, an acquisition of units of Rolls-Royce, and a shift of its power units to the United States.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The head of the German electronics and engineering giant Siemens said on Wednesday that the company would not be strong-armed into acquiring the power units of its French rival Alstom, displaying notably less ardor for a deal than was shown by its rival General Electric.

headline.main: Playing Down Any Alstom Move, Siemens Reorganizes and Makes Other Deals
headline.print_headline: Playing Down Any Alstom Move, Siemens Reorganizes and Makes Other Deals

byline.original: By Jack Ewing and Melissa Eddy
